text: Cable-Sakamoto station building is a funicular station in Ōtsu, Shiga, Japan. It is the longest cable-car route in Japan at 2,025 meters. The station opened in 1927. ==Lines== *Hieizan Railway **Sakamoto Cable ==Layout== The station is the lower terminal of the funicular. Platforms are on the both sides of one terminating track. ==Adjacent stations== ==References== Category:Railway stations in Shiga Prefecture Category:Buildings and structures in Ōtsu
title: Cable Sakamoto Station
